subject: Religion & Spirituality
title: The Big Bang: A Priest's Theory
description: A quick win: understand The Big Bang: A Priest's Theory.

hook.text: The Big Bang theory was proposed by a Catholic priest. The idea that the universe had a beginning was religious first.

buildup.text: Georges Lemaitre, a Belgian priest and physicist, proposed the 'primeval atom' in 1927. Einstein initially dismissed it.

discovery.text: Many scientists resisted the Big Bang because it sounded too much like Genesis. A beginning implied a Beginner.

twist.text: The Pope endorsed it. Lemaitre told him to stop. Mixing science and religion would hurt both, the priest warned.

climax.text: A priest created the theory atheists love, then told the Pope not to use it. Science and faith defy simple stories.

punchline.text: A priest invented the Big Bang. Then told the Pope not to claim it.

quiz.question: Who proposed the Big Bang theory?
